intro: Pulsatilla vulgaris subsp. oenipontana, commonly known as the meadow anemone, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces follicles that contain the seeds. It is a perennial species that is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
